column2: he case had been taken up for trial after the accused-appellant pleaded not guilty to the charges

column1: against him. Seven witnesses gave evidence for the prosecution and P 1 to P 5 were marked as

contradictions were marked as P 3 to P 5 and a few omissions were marked by both parties.

column2: he girl was born on 13.02.1996 and was identified as a person under the age of 16 at the time

column1: of the indictment. Those facts were admitted under section 420 of the Criminal Procedure Code.
After the trial, the accused-appellant was found guilty under two counts of rape by the learned
High Court Judge, and accordingly, the accused-appellant was sentenced to 15 years of rigorous
imprisonment for each count to run concurrently and was ordered that the accused-appellant
pay compensation of Rs. 500,000/- to the victim.
